block.p: The Procter & Gamble Company said today that its third-quarter earnings increased 11.8 percent, to $474 million, or $1.33 a share, spurred by improved sales, especially in overseas markets.
P.& G. earned $424 million, or $1.16 a share, during the comparable period a year ago.
Revenues rose 10 percent, to $7.48 billion from $6.8 billion.
The Procter & Gamble Company said today that its third-quarter earnings increased 11.8 percent, to $474 million, or $1.33 a share, spurred by improved sales, especially in overseas markets.
P.& G. earned $424 million, or $1.16 a share, during the comparable period a year ago.
Revenues rose 10 percent, to $7.48 billion from $6.8 billion.

Edwin L. Artzt, P.& G.'s chairman and chief executive, said unit volume, sales and pretax operating earnings were all up at least 10 percent in the quarter ended March 31, despite continued investment in new products.
Earlier this month the Cincinnati-based consumer-products giant announced a 10 percent increase in its stock dividend rate and declared a 2-for-1 stock split.
